name: Commonwealth of Pennsylvania v. Dunkirk, Allegheny Valley & Pittsburg Railroad Company, Appellant
name_abbreviation: Commonwealth v. Dunkirk, Allegheny Valley & Pittsburg Railroad

judges: Before Stebrett, C. J., Green, Williams, McCollum, Mitchell, Dean and Fell, JJ.
parties: Commonwealth of Pennsylvania v. Dunkirk, Allegheny Valley & Pittsburg Railroad Company, Appellant.

opinions.text:
Opinion by
Mr. Justice Dean,
This case is ruled by Commonwealth v. New York, Pennsylvania & Ohio Railroad Company, in which opinion is this day handed down, ante, p. 169. The assignments of error are overruled, and the judgment is affirmed.
opinions.author: Mr. Justice Dean,

attorneys: John P. Elkin, deputy attorney general, with him Henry Q. Me Oormiclc, attorney general, for appellee.
casebody.head_matter:
Commonwealth of Pennsylvania v. Dunkirk, Allegheny Valley & Pittsburg Railroad Company, Appellant.
October 17, 1898:
Argued June 2, 1897..
Reargued Feb. 23, 1898.
Appeal, No. 23, May T., 1897, by defendant, from judgment of C. P. Dauphin Co., Commonwealth Docket, 1896, No. 655, on appeal from tax settlement.
Before Stebrett, C. J., Green, Williams, McCollum, Mitchell, Dean and Fell, JJ.
Affirmed.
M. E. Olmsted, for appellant.
John P. Elkin, deputy attorney general, with him Henry Q. Me Oormiclc, attorney general, for appellee.
